name: otter-launcher
description: A versatile cli launcher built for keyboard-centric wm users, customizable with ascii art
readme_summary: Otter-launcher is a command-line program that allows users to launch commands, applications, or scripts with custom prefixes and keyboard shortcuts.  It supports fuzzy searching, tab completion, and customization options such as ASCII color codes and shell integration.  This makes it ideal for keyboard-centric workflows and integration with window managers.
key_features: Customizable shell or window manager for launching programs
primary_use_case: Launching shell scripts, applications, or arbitrary commands via a customizable command-line interface.

name: scrntime
description: CLI for displaying screentime/uptime for linux with afk support
readme_summary: scrntime is a command-line tool that calculates daily screen time by parsing system reboot logs.  It optionally integrates with idle time trackers (xprintidle, hypridle, swayidle) to subtract idle periods, providing a more accurate screen time usage report.  Users can customize the visualization of their screen time data.
key_features: Daily screen time tracking based on system reboot logs
Idle time subtraction from total screen time (optional)
Integration with xprintidle, hypridle, or swayidle for idle time management
primary_use_case: Display daily screen time usage over a specified number of days, accounting for idle time

name: letta
description: Letta (formerly MemGPT) is a framework for creating LLM services with memory.
readme_summary: Letta is an open-source framework for creating stateful LLM applications.  It enables the development of agents with advanced reasoning and persistent memory, offering both Docker and pip installation options and a REST API for interaction.  The framework is model-agnostic and designed for transparency.
key_features: Open source framework for building stateful LLM applications
Build stateful agents with advanced reasoning capabilities and transparent long-term memory
primary_use_case: Building stateful LLM applications and agents

name: pyenv
readme_summary: pyenv allows users to easily manage multiple Python versions.  It supports global, per-project, and environment variable-based version selection, enabling seamless switching between different Python installations for various development needs.  This is useful for testing across different Python versions or managing project-specific requirements.
key_features: Change the global Python version on a per-user basis
Override the Python version with an environment variable
Search for commands from multiple versions of Python at a time
primary_use_case: Switching between multiple versions of Python

name: web2py
description: Free and open source full-stack enterprise framework for agile development of secure database-driven web-based applications, written and programmable in Python.
readme_summary: web2py is a full-stack Python framework for building secure web applications.  It features a Database Abstraction Layer (DAL) and is compatible with Python 3.9+.  While not recommended for new projects, it shares design philosophy and components with its successor, py4web.
primary_use_case: Agile development of secure database-driven web applications

name: serviceradar
description: simple golang-based home network monitoring and surveillance tool
readme_summary: ServiceRadar is a distributed network monitoring system that provides real-time monitoring and cloud-based alerting.  It supports various monitoring methods including SNMP, ICMP, and specialized checks for Dusk nodes.  The system is designed for use in challenging environments with limited network access.
primary_use_case: Distributed network monitoring system for infrastructure and services in constrained environments

name: MegaParse
description: File Parser optimised for LLM Ingestion with no loss ðŸ§  Parse PDFs, Docx, PPTx in a format that is ideal for LLMs.
readme_summary: MegaParse is an open-source, versatile parser designed for efficient and accurate extraction of information from diverse document formats.  It prioritizes minimal information loss and supports various file types including PDFs, PowerPoint presentations, and Word documents.  MegaParse offers both command-line and API usage options.
primary_use_case: Parsing various document types (PDF, PowerPoint, Word, Excel, CSV, Text) with minimal information loss.

name: graftcp
description: A flexible tool for redirecting a given program's TCP traffic to SOCKS5 or HTTP proxy.
readme_summary: graftcp is a command-line tool that redirects TCP connections made by any program to SOCKS5 or HTTP proxies using ptrace(2).  It supports various configuration options and installation methods, including systemd service integration.  This allows users to route network traffic through proxies for applications that are not compatible with traditional proxy solutions.
key_features: TCP connection redirection to SOCKS5 or HTTP proxy
Uses ptrace(2) for hooking connect(2), enabling support for any program (unlike LD_PRELOAD-based solutions)
Offers command-line options for configuration and customization
Supports configuration via a configuration file
Provides local and system-wide installation options
Includes systemd service for background operation
primary_use_case: Redirecting TCP connections of a given program to SOCKS5 or HTTP proxies for network traffic routing and anonymization
